page.title: 12PHEASANT REARING AT GARROWBY
page.content: Over 5,500 pheasants are reared in three big huts. There are 20 cages in one big hut so in three big huts altogether there are 60 cages for the pheasants. When they are three weeks old they go into a run fixed on to the hut outside so they can run about and try flying. There is a Head Gamekeeper and two Under Keepers. In the shooting season 3 to 4 thousand pheasants are shot. There are usually about 10 guns on shooting days and there are 30 sometimes 40 beaters. They usually take about 4 dogs to help pick up the game.
